intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium semidovrense, commonly known as the semi-dovrense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellowish composite flowers that bloom in summer. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically visited by various pollinators such as bees and flies.
